alert.note: Alert for Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 7:16PM CDT until July 17 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WEBSTER AND NORTHWESTERN WRIGHT COUNTIES... At 715 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Niangua, or 11 miles east of Marshfield, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 709 PM golf ball sized hail was reported near Conway. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Duncan, Grovespring and Rader. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
